name: The Lighthouse on Cape d'Or

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We added a day to our trip so we could stay here & I'm so glad we did. The weather wasn't perfect, in fact it was cold, windy & some fog but all of that seemed to add to the atmosphere. We loved our stay & hope to stay again. Jack & Marie were wonderful. Dinner & breakfast were delicious.
reviews.title: What an experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd planned at the last minute a driving holiday around Nova Scotia and I'd come across this place in my searches. We didn't book, were fortunate enough to just ask when we got there and find one room left - it must have been waiting for us. There was a bit of a panic when we had to back into Advocate Harbour for some cash (no phone lines at the lighthouse so cash only) to find the ATM not working! However the lovely people in the petrol station gave us cashback. So back down the windy dirt track to the lighthouse and we were set for the night. The food was wonderful, the setting divine.....I loved it all - watching the sunset, looking at the stars, getting bitten to pieces by mosquitos, but hey, still had to be done. Just wonderful - stay there if you can.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem - want to keep it that way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted so badly to spend a night in the Lightkeeper's Cottage that we extended our trip to Nova Scotia by two days in order to do so. We are so glad we did! Being in Cape d'Or, being able to watch the Dory Rip, the seals and the tides going in and out was alone worth the effort. Add to that Darcy's excellent cooking and the charming personalities of Darcy, Jack and Marie, and you have a real winner. The rooms aren't elegant, but they are attractive, comfortable and spotlessly clean. If you have a chance to spend at least one night here, do it. You'll be glad you did.
reviews.title: Worth the effort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent the last night of our honeymoon dining at the restaurant on the premises and watching the sunset. It's an amazing setting, amazing views and hands down was the best night of our honeymoon. The location is inspiring, watching the tides change in the Bay of Fundy. The dining room staff were pleasant and the owner was very social. We enjoyed our food (scallops, shrimp and dessert) and would recommend this restaurant and scenic view to everyone visiting Nova Scotia. We loved it...absolutely perfect! The road in is long and the driveway down is interesting, but don't let it stop you!
reviews.title: Wonderful Dining Experience...Make This a Stop on Your Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great time on our visit. Even though weather could have been better we enjoyed our stay immensely. The setting, sunrise and sunset from the same location, was fantastic.
reviews.title: Wonderful time at Cape D'or
What a find!
reviews.text: OH MY GOD, if you're traveling anywhere near the northern shores of NS, I would heartily recommend a night or two here. The lighthouse is perched on the tip of a Cape and has increible views in all directions. The rooms (in the old lighthouse keeper's home) are nice and the restaurant serves freshly cooked, home style meals. Darcy, the owner, is right there with you and will provide all sorts of hiking and activity suggestions - or just sit and relax with a good book and enjoy the great view! If you can time right, make sure to be there for the beginning or the end of the high tide coming in and you can watch the Dory Rip appear and disappear before your very eyes - very cool!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked the Cape D'Or Lighthouse so much, once we got there, we just didn't leave the grounds for two days. The Bay of Fundy setting is gorgeous. The whole staff and all the guests come out to look at the sunset.
reviews.title: Gorgeous lighthouse, yummy food, friendly hosts

likes.liked: — beautiful views in all directions, comfortable beds and rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't expect the rooms in the keeper's cottage to be so nice. All have great views, tastefully decorated with lots of pictures from the lighthouse.
reviews.title: Great Food and Scenery!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was great, every meal. Sarah picked fresh blueberries and Andrew threw them in the meal. Darcy is a gracious and goofy host who will be played by Jack Black if there's a movie of the place. There are very few places you can stay at a lighthouse and I've never heard of any that come with such amazing food, relaxed atmosphere and that let you bring your dog.
reviews.title: Greatest views

likes.disliked: — gravel road must walk down to get to lighhouse-it was raining

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited this property after reading about it online...the result of a random search on neat things to do in Nova Scotia. I contacted Darcy directly as i was booking from Australia and arrranged everything via email as if we were sitting in the same room.
reviews.title: Unique experience

reviews.text: Staying in room 2, we had a view of the bay from our bedroom and a well appointed bathroom (incl shower) across the hall. The bed was very comfortable and had plenty of blankets in case of chilly weather.
reviews.title: Fabulous Place

aka: The Lighthouse On Cape d`Or Hotel
description: A unique oceanside dining and overnight accommodation facility located on the rugged shore of the Bay of Fundy. If you are looking for shopping malls, knick knacks or urban style night life then come for a day visit and keep on truckin' as we are none of the above. We offer a place to unwind and enjoy what the Bay of Fundy has to offer. Open May - November
